results.name: Lincoln Square Pancake House

evidences.snippet: I explained that I'm allergic to onion and strongly dislike green pepper. When I use to live near by they would always just substitute it for me. I was assured this wasn't an issue. Allergies are no joke. I will never attend any of their establishments again because if you as a company desires to lie when a customer complains because you could have hospitalized them, then clearly you care more about your reputation then doing what is right. If you have food allergies this establishment is not

justification.reasoning: The review contains a firsthand allergy concern (onion allergy) with an explicit assurance of safety that was cited as a problem, indicating a potential safety risk. This yields a mild incident (2 points) plus a false-assurance modifier (+5), totaling 7, which meets the threshold for High Risk under the provided scoring rules.
